skill.name: specs-creator
skill.description: Creates detailed specifications from client needs including product specs, technical specs, design specs, and API specs. Use when the user requests help with requirement gathering, creating specifications, documenting client requirements, converting feature requests into structured specs, or needs to formalize project requirements for development handoff.
skill.summary: Transforms client requirements into structured development-ready specifications for product, technical, design, and API documentation.
skill.author: Emz1998

security_audit.summary: All 161 static findings evaluated as false positives. The skill consists of documentation, templates, and validation scripts for specification creation. No malicious code patterns, command injection vectors, or credential exfiltration detected. The flagged backticks are markdown code formatting, not shell execution. References to cryptographic terms are standard industry practices in documentation examples.

content.user_title: Create detailed product and technical specifications
content.value_statement: Transforms raw client requirements into comprehensive, development-ready specifications for product, technical, design, and API documentation, ensuring nothing is missed during requirement gathering.
actual_capabilities: Creates product specifications (PRDs) with user stories, requirements, and success metrics
Develops technical specifications covering architecture, components, and data models
Writes design specifications including UI/UX requirements and accessibility guidelines
Documents API specifications with endpoints, authentication, and rate limiting
Validates specifications for completeness, clarity, and consistency
Uses structured question patterns to gather comprehensive requirements
limitations: Does not execute code or interact with external systems
Does not generate implementation code or tests
Does not integrate with project management tools
Relies on user input for complete and accurate requirements

use_cases.title: Product managers creating feature PRDs
use_cases.description: Gather requirements from stakeholders and transform them into comprehensive product requirement documents with user stories, acceptance criteria, and success metrics.

use_cases.title: Software architects documenting system design
use_cases.description: Create detailed technical specifications including architecture diagrams, component definitions, data models, and API contracts for development teams.

use_cases.title: Development teams standardizing documentation
use_cases.description: Establish consistent specification formats across teams to improve handover clarity, reduce misunderstandings, and speed up development cycles.

prompt_templates.title: Basic product specification request
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a product specification for a [feature name] that helps [target users] achieve [goal]. Include problem statement, user stories, core requirements, and success metrics.
prompt_templates.scenario: Starting a new feature or product initiative

prompt_templates.title: Technical architecture specification
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a technical specification for implementing [feature] using [technology stack]. Cover system architecture, component design, data models, API endpoints, security considerations, and deployment approach.
prompt_templates.scenario: Planning technical implementation of a feature

prompt_templates.title: API documentation request
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a complete API specification for our [API name] service. Include authentication, rate limiting, all endpoints with request/response examples, error handling, and versioning strategy.
prompt_templates.scenario: Documenting or designing a new API

prompt_templates.title: Full specification from minimal input
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create specifications for [project/feature]. Ask me targeted questions to gather all necessary requirements, then create comprehensive product, technical, and design specifications using appropriate templates.

output_examples.input: Create a product specification for a user authentication feature
output: Implement secure user authentication allowing users to sign up, log in, and manage their accounts.
Users currently cannot create accounts or authenticate securely...
- As a new user, I want to create an account with email and password
- As a returning user, I want to log in securely
- As a user, I want to reset my password if forgotten

output_examples.input: Write an API specification for a user endpoint

best_practices: Start by identifying the specification type and audience before gathering requirements
Use concrete examples and measurable criteria instead of vague terms like 'fast' or 'secure'
Validate specifications for completeness, consistency, and feasibility before finalizing
anti_patterns: Skipping the requirement gathering phase and jumping straight to documentation
Using vague requirements without measurable acceptance criteria
Failing to identify dependencies, constraints, and out-of-scope items

faq.question: What specification types does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill supports Product Specifications (PRDs), Technical Specifications, Design Specifications, API Specifications, and System Specifications.

faq.question: Does this skill generate code or implementations?
faq.answer: No, this skill focuses on documentation and specifications. It does not write implementation code, tests, or configurations.

faq.question: How detailed are the specifications created?
faq.answer: Specifications are as detailed as the input provided. The skill asks follow-up questions to gather missing information and creates comprehensive documents based on available requirements.

faq.question: Can I use my own templates?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill can adapt to custom templates. Provide your template and the skill will follow its structure when creating specifications.

faq.question: What makes a good specification?
faq.answer: Good specifications have specific measurable criteria, concrete examples, defined edge cases, explicit dependencies, quantified performance requirements, and clear acceptance criteria.

faq.question: How does the validation work?
faq.answer: The skill includes validation checks for clarity, completeness, consistency, and feasibility. It identifies gaps, ambiguities, and missing information in specifications.
